Class FileParser

java.lang.Object
pt.up.fe.els2024.parser.FileParser
Direct Known Subclasses:
JSONParser, XMLParser, YAMLParser
public abstract class FileParser extends Object
Abstract class FileParser provides functionality for parsing data from a file into a Table object. Subclasses must implement the readData(File) method to handle the file-specific parsing logic. The class is designed to work with files that contain structured data, which can be parsed into columns and rows.

This class supports both simple values and nested data structures, such as lists and maps, and provides methods to convert them into a structured Table representation.

      public FileParser()

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public abstract Map<String,Object> readData(File file) throws IOException, ParserException
      Reads the raw data from a file and returns it as a map of key-value pairs.

      This method must be implemented by subclasses to provide the specific file-reading logic.

      Parameters:
      file - the file to read the data from
      Returns:
      a map representing the data in the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue reading the file
      ParserException - if there is a problem parsing the file's contents

    • parseFile

      public Table parseFile(File file, String fileName) throws IOException, ParserException
      Parses the data from a file and returns it as a Table.

      This method first calls readData(File) to obtain the raw data from the file and then processes it using the parse(Map, String) method to convert it into a structured table.

      Parameters:
      file - the file to parse
      fileName - the name of the file, used for the table's identification
      Returns:
      a Table object representing the parsed data
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue reading the file
      ParserException - if there is a problem parsing the file's contents

    • extractPairs

      public LinkedHashMap<String,Object> extractPairs(Object value)
      Extracts key-value pairs from an object, assuming it is a LinkedHashMap.

      This method converts the raw data into a LinkedHashMap with String keys and Object values. It is useful when parsing nested data structures.

      Parameters:
      value - the object to extract key-value pairs from
      Returns:
      a LinkedHashMap containing the extracted pairs
